com.hazelcast.map.impl.nearcache

Interface NearCacheInvalidator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNearCacheInvalidator, BatchInvalidator, NonStopInvalidator

    public interface NearCacheInvalidator
    Responsible for local and remote near-cache invalidation. Local near-caches are node local, remote near-caches can be exist on remote nodes or clients.
    Since:
    3.6

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear(String mapName, boolean owner, String sourceUuid)
      Clears local and remote near-caches.
      void destroy(String mapName)
      Removes supplied maps invalidation queue and flushes its content.
      void invalidate(String mapName, Data key, String sourceUuid)
      Invalidates local and remote near-caches.
      void invalidate(String mapName, List<Data> keys, String sourceUuid)
      Invalidates local and remote near-caches.
      void reset()
      Resets this invalidator back to its initial state.
      void shutdown()
      Shuts down this invalidator and releases used resources.

    • Method Detail

      • invalidate

        void invalidate(String mapName,
              Data key,
              String sourceUuid)
        Invalidates local and remote near-caches. Local near-caches are node local, remote near-caches can be exist on remote members or clients.
        Parameters:
        mapName - name of the map.
        key - key of the entry to be removed from near-cache.
        sourceUuid - caller uuid

      • invalidate

        void invalidate(String mapName,
              List<Data> keys,
              String sourceUuid)
        Invalidates local and remote near-caches. Local near-caches are node local, remote near-caches can be exist on remote members or clients.
        Parameters:
        mapName - name of the map.
        keys - keys of the entries to be removed from near-cache.
        sourceUuid - caller uuid

      • clear

        void clear(String mapName,
         boolean owner,
         String sourceUuid)
        Clears local and remote near-caches. Local near-caches are node local, remote near-caches can be exist on remote members or clients.
        Parameters:
        mapName - name of the map.
        owner - true if this method is called from partition owner, otherwise false.
        sourceUuid - caller uuid

      • destroy

        void destroy(String mapName)
        Removes supplied maps invalidation queue and flushes its content. This method is called when removing a near-cache with MapRemoteService.destroyDistributedObject(String)
        Parameters:
        mapName - name of the map.
        See Also:
        MapRemoteService.destroyDistributedObject(String)

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets this invalidator back to its initial state. Aimed to call with ManagedService.reset()
        See Also:
        ManagedService#reset()}

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down this invalidator and releases used resources. Aimed to call with ManagedService.shutdown(boolean)
        See Also:
        com.hazelcast.spi.ManagedService#shutdown(boolean)}
